Text:
first of all thanks for uploading this....but you could you tell me exactly what program I should use to decompress this to wbfs and how to go about it...I'm a bit thick you see...
.much appreciated

download WIT from http://wit.wiimm.de/download.html (assuming youre using windows: http://wit.wiimm.de/download/wit-v2.07a-r3955-cygwin.zip ), uncompress the downloaded .zip file with something like winzip somewhere in your path (that means somewhere where can and usually you run commands from), open a command shell from where you placed the downloaded .wia and type quote: wit copy "Williams Pinball Classics [RWCP6M].wia" --wbfs %X
or use the word convert instead of copy if you dont want to keep the original .wia file

thanks for the quick reply dude...I struggled abit with your method (I told you I was thick), anyways after a bit of googleing I came across a program called wii backup fusion that sorted it for me..hope this helps any other dumbass out there...and again thanks for sharing man

thanks winkywoowaa.... 

people should remember that we do not want to be typing commands, just want to click a button.....
